Dear Sheffield City Council,
I am writing to make a request for information under the Freedom of Information Act 2000.
- A copy of the policy which states that 1:1 support should not be included as a provision in section F. I have been told this is local authority policy by an Inclusion Officer for SENDSARS.
- A copy of the policy which states that unless the local authority has professional reports stating changes to Section B and F, the Local Authority does not authorise it's staff to make changes. I have been told this is local authority policy by an Inclusion Officer for SENDSARS. NB. If you do not have a written policy on this, but believe it to be part of SEN law, please can you direct me to the relevant section of legislation.
Yours faithfully,
R Walton

Dear R Walton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Sheffield SEND
policies which we received on 19/05/2024.
Please find Sheffield City Council’s response to your request set out
below:
- A copy of the policy which states that 1:1 support should not be
included as a provision in section F. I have been told this is local
authority policy by an Inclusion Officer for SENDSARS.
The Local Authority does not have a policy that says that 1:1 support
should not be included in EHC plans. This is something that is considered
on a case-by-case basis based on the evidence provided by professionals
working with the child/young person.
- A copy of the policy which states that unless the local authority has
professional reports stating changes to Section B and F, the Local
Authority does not authorise it's staff to make changes. I have been told
this is local authority policy by an Inclusion Officer for SENDSARS. NB.
If you do not have a written policy on this, but believe it to be part of
SEN law, please can you direct me to the relevant section of legislation.
Changes to sections B and F of an EHC plan should be based on evidence
provided as part of an annual review or reassessment. SENDSARS perform an
administrative role making amendments based on the information provided.
SENDSARS will not agree to make changes unless they are evidence based.
If you have any queries about this response, please do not hesitate to
contact us.
The information provided in this response is available for re-use under
the terms of the Open Government Licence v3.0. The terms of the OGL can be
found [1]here. When re-using the information, Sheffield City Council
requires you to include the following attribution statement: “Contains
public sector information obtained from Sheffield City Council and
licensed under the Open Government Licence v3.0.”
If you are unhappy with the response you have received in relation to your
request, you are entitled to have this reviewed. You can ask for an
internal review by replying to this email. Internal review requests should
be submitted within 40 working days from the date of this response.
If you remain dissatisfied with the outcome of your internal review, you
can contact the Information Commissioner’s Office. Please see

Kind Regards,

Dear FOI,
In your response you state that "Changes to sections B and F of an EHC plan should be based on evidence provided as part of an annual review or reassessment."
Please can you clarify who you will and will not accept evidence from, including the following people:
- Educational Psychologist
- Speech Therapist
- SENCo
- Teachers
- Locality SENCo
- Parents providing evidence from national guidelines, research, etc
Yours sincerely,
R Walton
